project_descr: THIS PROJECT AIMS TO SCALING-UP THE NATIONAL RESPONSE TO TUBERCULOSIS IN STP

outputs.output_descr: São Tomé and Príncipe (STP) is a small lower-middle-income country with a low human development index, with a population that was estimated at 187,604 in 2014 (Instituto Nacional das Estatísticas, INE).  The per capita income of US$1,609.82 places the country below the average for Sub-Saharan Africa. Approximately 54 percent of its population of 187,604 is poor and 15 percent live in extreme poverty. The country ranks 144 out of 186 countries in the 2014 UNDP Human Development Index. Life expectancy is 69.7 years and adult literacy rate is estimated at 69.5%. Each year, it notified an average
donor_name: GOVERNMENT OF SAO TOME AND PRINCIPE
GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

document_name: Scaling Up the National Response to Tuberculosis in Sao Tome and Principe
